name: Releaf Earth
headline: Turning food waste into Biochar to remove CO2 from the atmsophere
description:
Releaf Earth is a climate tech startup pioneering carbon removal and agricultural solutions leveraging biochar (BCR). Expanding from our roots in food processing technology, we now specialize in producing premium biochar from palm kernel shells. Biochar Carbon Removal (BCR) is a powerful tool for carbon sequestration and a key technology for economic development in Africa.

African farmers already experience a 150% global mean temperature rise from a climate crisis they didn’t cause. Releaf's mission is to empower rural communities with improved productivity, crop yields, and a role in achieving Net Zero Emissions.

founders.name: Uzoma Ayogu, Founder/CTO
founders.description:
Uzo is CTO & Co-founder of Releaf - 
Uzo graduated from Duke with a degree in Mechanical engineering in 2017 and currently serves on Duke’s Board of Trustees as a full voting member. 

Uzo has professional experience working on jet engines at GE Aviation, devising, funding,  building resilient engineering impact projects in sanitation & water in rural Brazil & Togo, & independent research research on autonomous drone medical delivery.

founders.name: Kenna Nzewi, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Co-founder + CEO of Releaf. We develop technology to unlock the processing of local crop varieties in emerging markets.

# Harnessing African agriculture to heal The Earth’s climate
We are revolutionizing agriculture by combining environmental protection with economic empowerment, creating a future where farming benefits both the planet and the people who grow our food.
[Learn more](http://www.releaf.africa/<#home_about>)
## We turn waste into more yields for farmers.
Releaf Earth provides solutions for large-scale biochar production in Africa. Releaf’s biochar offers a triple win: permanently removing CO₂, enhancing soil fertility, and providing wealth to opportunity in rural communities.
Certified by:

## 
Releaf
Earth
is
Nigeria’s
first
industrial
biochar
producer.
Releaf’s
biochar
offers
triple
impact:
enhanced
soil
fertility,
permanently
removed
CO₂,
and
a
new
industry
in
rural
communities.
We believe biochar carbon removal offers the best opportunity for rapid carbon removal, thanks to its cost efficiency and scalability.
## Releaf’s Biochar Process
Releaf leverages its own proprietary tools and partners with leading biochar technologists to deliver verifiable, cost-efficient, and community impacting carbon removal.
### [Kraken System01Releaf invented and patented Kraken, an oil palm de-shelling technology specialized for smallholder varieties of oil palm and rural, off-grid use. We buy nuts from smallholder farmers and de-shell them with kraken, creating agricultural waste in the form of palm kernel shells.](http://www.releaf.africa/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-0>)### [Pyrolyzer02Because every biochar project is different, Releaf has vetted 30+ pyrolysis manufacturers to select the most appropriate technology based on a project’s feedstock(s), location, and workforce availability.](http://www.releaf.africa/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-1>)### [MRV03Releaf leverages independent Measurement, Reporting, and Verification applications for all its owned biochar production projects, ensuring verification of carbon removal.](http://www.releaf.africa/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-2>)### [SITE04In addition to leveraging third party MRVs, Releaf has built a proprietary geospatial mapping tool called SITE to plan the location of biochar facilities in close proximity of sustainable feedstocks. With SITE, project developers gain unparalleled insights into the most profitable locations for their next processing facilities.](http://www.releaf.africa/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-3>)
![Kraken image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/67898505400216f409ef7855/678a5048695af76b1f767387_Tab%20img.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/67898505400216f409ef7855/6792dc40efd315546ddf0c7e_Biokiln%201.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/67898505400216f409ef7855/6792dc40e51a9daad1b4e8db_img%20\(6\).png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/67898505400216f409ef7855/6792dc40f651b8679a392608_img%20\(7\).png)
Building a Greener, More Prosperous Future
## Releaf's Roadmap
### 700,000
Metric Tons of CO₂e removed by 2030.
### 50,000
Metric Tons of waste biomass recycled annually.
### 20,000
Metric Tons of biochar produced annually.
### 500+
Jobs created in the carbon removal industry.
### 50%
Of all carbon removal jobs filled by women.
### 15
Production sites planned by 2030.
### #1
Targeted position as the world’s largest carbon removal company by 2030.
### 40%
Increase in crop yields for rural smallholder farmers
## Africa’s Strong Advantage
We believe Africa has natural advantages to become the largest and most affordable Biochar producer on Earth, based on its structural and economic factors.
### Abundant Raw Materials
Africa generates an impressive 1.4 billion tons of biomass annually, providing a sustainable and readily available feedstock for biochar production. This ensures a consistent and scalable supply chain for global carbon removal needs.
### Affordable Labor
With labor costs 50-80% lower than in other regions, Africa offers a significant economic advantage in biochar production. This makes large-scale operations not only feasible but also highly cost-effective, driving greater accessibility to carbon solutions.
### Self-Sufficient Infrastructure
Biochar production in Africa leverages a unique advantage: it generates its own energy during the manufacturing process. This eliminates the need for grid electricity, enabling decentralized operations even in remote areas, while reducing dependence on fossil fuels.
## Africa’s Unique Carbon Removal Potential
Time is running out. To meet global climate goals, carbon removal must scale 14,000-fold, reaching 10 billion tons annually in the next 25 years.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/67898505400216f409ef7855/6792daed3f0f8bd43e20ca95_Frame%2039.png)
## We’re here to help unlock Africa’s Carbon Revolution
At Releaf, we’re dedicated to researching the biggest problems plaguing the agricultural sector and building high-end technology to solve these issues. We’re able to license our proprietary technology to help relevant stakeholders overcome these challenges as well.

generated_description:
**Releaf Earth: Biomass Waste into Agricultural Gold**

Releaf Earth is not just another climate tech startup; it's a dynamic player in the fight against climate change and a champion for African agriculture. Founded in 2017 in Lagos, Nigeria, Releaf Earth was part of the prestigious Y Combinator Batch S17, and it has rapidly distinguished itself as Nigeria’s first industrial biochar producer. At its core, Releaf's mission is clear: turn food waste into biochar to remove CO₂ from the atmosphere, effectively contributing to carbon sequestration while empowering local communities.

### What is Biochar?

Biochar is a form of charcoal produced from biomass through a process called pyrolysis. It has gained traction as a powerful tool for carbon removal and soil enhancement. Releaf Earth focuses on creating premium biochar from palm kernel shells—a resource that is abundant in Africa. By transforming waste into valuable biochar, the company wraps environmental protection in economic empowerment, enhancing soil fertility and enabling rural farmers to increase their productivity.

### The Dual Challenge

Farmers in Africa, particularly in vulnerable communities, are facing a daunting 150% rise in mean temperatures due to the climate crisis they never initiated. Releaf aims to combat this by enhancing crop yields and creating sustainable livelihood opportunities. Their ambitious roadmap includes removing 700,000 metric tons of CO₂ equivalent by 2030 and producing 20,000 metric tons of biochar annually while creating over 500 jobs, half of which they aim to fill with women.

### Innovations at Work

1. **Kraken Technology**: A breakthrough innovation, Kraken is a patented oil palm de-shelling technology tailored for smallholders and off-grid applications. By sourcing palm nuts directly from farmers, Releaf creates agricultural waste in the form of palm kernel shells, which feed their biochar production.

2. **Smart Pyrolysis**: Releaf assesses the optimal pyrolysis manufacturers based on project-specific needs—ensuring every biochar project is tailored to its local context.

3. **Measurement & Verification**: Independent measurement solutions are leveraged to ensure the authenticity of the carbon removal claims Releaf makes through its projects.

4. **Geospatial Planning with SITE**: By developing its own geospatial mapping tool, Releaf locates biochar facilities near sustainable biomass sources, maximizing profitability and efficiency.

### Why Africa?

Africa possesses unique advantages for biochar production:
- **Abundant Biomass**: With around 1.4 billion tons of biomass produced annually, there's no shortage of feedstock for biochar.
- **Cost-Effective Labor**: Labor costs in the region are significantly lower than elsewhere, which optimizes production expenses.
- **Energy Independence**: The production process is self-sustaining, generating its own energy and reducing reliance on external power sources.

### Impact Beyond the Environment

Releaf is committed to not only reversing climate change through innovative technology but also enhancing social equity by prioritizing women in the workforce and supporting rural economies. The goal is clear: to make Releaf Earth the largest carbon removal company by 2030 and catalyze a sustainable revolution across Africa.

In a world where climate change threatens livelihoods and ecosystems, Releaf Earth stands as a beacon of how we can turn waste into wealth, heal our planet, and empower communities. If you're intrigued and want to learn more, visit [Releaf Africa](http://www.releaf.africa).
